articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: The strikes came after days of bombing by Israel of Beirut suburbs considered strongholds for Hezbollah.
articles.title: Heavy strikes shake Beirut as Israel expands Lebanon campaign

articles.author: Mohammed Salem, Hatem Khaled, Emma Farge, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: In the ruins of his two-storey home, 11-year-old Mohammed gathers chunks of the fallen roof into a broken pail and pounds them into gravel which his father will use to make gravestones for victims of the Gaza war.
articles.title: After a year of war, Gazans wonder how to deal with tonnes of rubble

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of pro-Palestinian demonstrators protested in cities around the world on Sunday on the eve of the first anniversary of the deadly Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel that triggered the war in Gaza.
articles.title: Thousands stage pro-Palestinian protests worldwide, on eve of Oct 7 attack that triggered Gaza war

articles.author: Rami Amichay, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: One commemoration of the Oct. 7 assault on southern Israel will be a live, public ceremony to be held at a large venue in Tel Aviv. The other on Monday, will be a pre-recorded televised tribute that leaves little to chance.
articles.title: Two ceremonies show Israel's conflicting narratives over Oct. 7

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The deputy prime minister faces a possible six-year jail term for refusing to let a migrant boat dock when he was interior minister in 2019.
articles.title: Europe's far-right rallies round Salvini ahead of boat verdict

articles.author: Fedja Grulovic
articles.title: Bosnian villagers sift through ruined homes after devastating flash floods

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tunisia's polling stations opened on Sunday for the country's presidential election, with three candidates running, including one in jail.
articles.title: Tunisia polling stations open for presidential election

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: At least five people have died and more than 100,000 remain stranded as devastating floods, triggered by heavy rains and upstream torrents, continue to ravage northern Bangladesh, officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Floods in Bangladesh leave five dead, thousands stranded

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke by telephone with French President Emmanuel Macron on Sunday, his office said, and told him that placing restrictions on Israel will just serve Iran and its proxies.
articles.title: Netanyahu tells Macron that putting limits on Israel will strengthen Iran

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis on Sunday announced he will appoint 21 new cardinals of the global Catholic Church, in an unexpected push to influence the powerful group of churchmen that will one day choose his successor.
articles.title: Pope Francis to appoint 21 new cardinals on Dec. 8
